intro: Pitardella caudatifolia, commonly known as the long-tailed pitardella, is a unique flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species.
